description:
PyDev is a Python IDE extension for Eclipse which may be used for Python, Jython and IronPython development (and is among the leading tools for Python coding).

It comes with many goodies such as:

- [Django integration](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_django.html)
- [Code completion](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_complctx.html)
- [Code completion with auto import](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_complnoctx.html)
- [Type hinting](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_type_hints.html)
- [Code analysis](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_code_analysis.html)
- [Go to definition](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_gotodef.html)
- [Refactoring](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_refactoring.html)
- [Debugger](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_debugger.html)
- [Remote debugger](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_remote_debugger.html)
- [Find Referrers in Debugger](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_debugger_find_referrers.html)
- [Tokens browser](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_open_decl_quick.html)
- [Interactive console](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_interactive_console.html)
- [Unittest integration](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_pyunit.html)
- [Code coverage](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_coverage.html)
- [PyLint integration](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_pylint.html)
- [MyPy integration](https://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_mypy.html)
- Find References (Ctrl+Shift+G)
- and [many others](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_features.html).

For more details on the provided features, check the [Features Matrix](http://www.pydev.org/manual_adv_features.html).

While not required to install, PyDev is not much use without an installation of [Python](https://chocolatey.org/packages?q=python) (2.6 or newer).

### Important Note:
This package drops the PyDev extension into a Chocolately-installed, [*Eclipse*](https://chocolatey.org/packages/eclipse) folder structure.  If Eclipse is upgraded, the PyDev files will be erased although Chocolatey will still consider it installed.  The PyDev package will then need to be re-installed/upgraded using the `-force` option.
author: Fabio Zadrozny
